results.title: The Emperor's new clothes
results.creator_credit: Carole F Schwartz and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s classic story series”.
A live action film that tells the tale of an emperor who employs two tailors who make him a special robe. What he doesn’t know is that these two rogues are not tailors at all and when the emperor appears in public in his special new robe, no one can quite believe their eyes. Adapted from Hans Christian Andersen’s well-loved tale.

results.title: Sibling rivalries and parents
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Rivalry among brothers and sisters. Reasons for this rivalry, the varied manifestations of it, and means of holding natural friction to a minimum.

results.title: The Twelve months examination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”
The child’s personality has developed to the point where he has begun to relate closely to members of the family and their friends. He realises that people and objects have separate existence apart from himself, and that they continue to exist when they are out of sight. The primitive motor reflexes have been replaced with definitive motor actions.

results.title: Social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
An analysis of social behaviour at different age levels and the reasons underlying the changes in behaviour patterns as the child develops. Stresses the point that while the child must meet and solve each problem as they reach that level of growth, guidance from understanding parents can make the adjustment easier and smoother.

results.title: Children's emotions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Child development series”.
Correlated with the book “Child development” by Elizabeth B. Hurlock, Ph. D., this film discusses the major emotions of childhood; curiosity, fear, anger, jealousy and joy. Children’s emotions are intense, frequent, but of short duration, and result in a number of behaviour responses.

results.title: Child care and development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
The film gives overall consideration to the habits of daily physical care that ensure a happy, healthy child. Correct attitudes and procedures toward establishing good habits of eating, sleeping, and bathing are covered. Stresses the elements of good diet. The question of proper clothing - warm and light for the infant, sturdy and functional for the toddler - is explored. Raises the important consideration of suitable and becoming clothing as exerting considerable psychological influence on personality development. The importance of outdoor exercise is stressed. The film shows the importance of the attitudes of both parents and children towards good routines of daily living.

results.title: The Six months examination
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
Simple, reliable testing of a child aged six months. The baby’s social development is shown in his positive and inquisitive reaction to the world around him even though his emotional and physical scope is still very limited. Simple vision and learning, motor development, and postural responses are tested.

results.title: Catalysis
results.creator_credit: Manufacturing Chemists' Association and CHEM Study
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study Series”.
Emphasises that catalysts are typical chemical reactants, being unique only in that catalysts are regenerated during the reaction. Demonstrates, using animation, and interprets three simple catalyzed reactions: the decomposition of formic acid, using sulphuric acid as catalyst; the reactions between hydrogen and oxygen, using pure platinum as catalyst; and the reaction between acidified benzidine and hydrogen peroxide using peroxidase in the human blood as a catalyst.
results.description:
